description: Dip chicken pieces in Italian dressing and roll in bread crumbs.
Place on liner pan.
Nu-Wave 8 minutes per side (or until done).
Open oven and spoon sauce on each piece and sprinkle with cheese.
Cook 2 more minutes.
In a bowl, combine the breadcrumbs with the meat and two eggs.
Add plenty of freshly grated Parmesan.
Add some parsley and garlic.
Add plenty of freshly ground black pepper and a little salt.
Mix it all together.
Scoop out balls, roll them up neatly, and place them on a pan.
Stick the pan in the freezer for about 5 or 10 minutes.
Heat up some olive oil in a heavy pot or skillet.
When the oil's hot, add about eight of the meatballs.
Cook the for a couple of minutes, turning them brown on all sides.
Remove the meatballs when they're brown on the outside but not done on the inside.
Repeat with all the meatballs until they're all browned and delicious.
Keep the same pot over medium-high heat.
Throw in the chopped up onions and garlic.
Stir around and cook for a couple of minutes.
Crush up tomatoes and pour them into the pot.
Add some red pepper flakes.
Stir in the parsley.
Add salt, pepper, and a little bit of sugar.
Heat it up and cook the sauce for about 20 minutes.
Add the meatballs.
Stir them into the sauce.
Allow the sauce to simmer for about 30 more minutes.
Stir the sauce very gently a couple of times.
Cook the spaghetti.
Pile on the sauce and parmesan.
